title: Apert Syndrome: Epidemiology and Demographics
short_description: Clinical document detailing the incidence, demographics, and historical reporting of Apert syndrome.
long_description: This clinical research document provides epidemiological data on Apert syndrome, a rare genetic disorder. The document presents key statistical information including the estimated birth incidence rate of approximately 1 in 65,000 births, equal gender distribution, and historical context noting over 300 documented cases since the condition's initial description in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. The document also highlights demographic variations, specifically noting higher incidence rates among Asian populations.
